story.text: AMSTERDAM Jan 2 Dutch financial services group ING Groep NV (ING.AS)(ING.N) said on Tuesday it has completed the sale of Degussa Bank, resulting in a net accounting loss of about 15 million euros ($19.78 million). ING (ING.AS)(ING.N), one of the top five insurers in Europe, announced the deal to sell the bank to a German investment group including private bank MM Warburg & Co. and various private investors on Nov. 27. Degussa Bank, which specialises in banking for companies and their employees, was a subsidiary of ING-Diba, the German direct bank owned by ING.
story.title: ing completes sale of degussa bank
